title: Can a person see himself as evil? - Quora

response.answer_text: I highly doubt it. I dont believe anyone intentionally wants to do anything they consider immoral, wrong or impractical.  If they do something that we consider unethical or evil in our eyes, to them they likely see it as justified for whatever the reason(mental health problems, harsh circumstances etc.)

I have experienced people doing extremely evil acts towards me but have found ways to justify their actions.   I do not think anyone thinks they are evil. They think 'Oh, if you were in the same position you would have made the same decision' 'It's not my fault, I was forced into this position and I had no choice' etc. You always have a choice, it is that you do not like the consequences.

First you have to consider what the word good means to that particular person. Often times people who come off as being evil/sinister falls on the observers beliefs. For example: you may believe hurting animals is wrong. You see someone torturing a cat. The red flag is immediately raised.
it will depend because sometimes the person who doing something very malicious could think it would make he or she feel better but people do evil things for certain reasons.
